enumDescriptions.DynamicSmartArray: A controller that allows software RAID configuration
enumDescriptions.SmartArray: A controller that supports all SmartArray features and configuration
enumDescriptions.SmartHBA: A controller that functions natively as an HBA, but has a ValueRAID mode for basic RAID configuration

ArrayCount.description: The number of arrays configured on this controller

BackupPowerSourceStatus.description: The current status of the backup power source (battery, capacitor, megacell etc.)

enumDescriptions.NotPresent: The backup power source is not present
enumDescriptions.Present: The backup power source is present but charging information is unknown
enumDescriptions.PresentAndCharged: The backup power source is present and fully charged
enumDescriptions.PresentAndCharging: The backup power source is present and is currently charging

BootVolumePrimary.description: The primary boot volume of this controller

BootVolumeSecondary.description: The secondary boot volume of this controller

CacheArrayCount.description: The number of cache arrays configured on this controller

CacheLogicalDriveCount.description: The number of cache logical drives configured on this controller

CacheMemorySizeMiB.description: The total cache memory size for the controller in MiB

CacheModuleSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the Cache Module.

CachePhysicalDriveCount.description: The number of physical drives assigned as cache drives attached to this controller

CurrentOperatingMode.description: The current operating mode of the controller.

enumDescriptions.HBA: The controller is currently functioning in HBA mode
enumDescriptions.RAID: The controller is currently functioning in RAID mode
enumDescriptions.Mixed: The controller is currently functioning in Mixed mode

CurrentParallelSurfaceScanCount.description: Number of disks the controller is scanning in parallel

DataLogicalDriveCount.description: The number of data logical drives configured on this controller

DataPhysicalDriveCount.description: The number of physical drives assigned as data drives attached to this controller

DegradedPerformanceOptimization.description: Enables the controller to attempt to improve performance on RAID 5/50/6(ADG)/60 logical drives when one or more physical drives in the logical drive are failed

enumDescriptions.Disabled: The controller will not buffer, which may result in reading from the same drive multiple times
enumDescriptions.Enabled: The controller will attempt to improve performance by buffering physical drive requests

DriveWriteCache.description: Enables or disables the write cache of the physical drives attached to the controller

enumDescriptions.Disabled: The write cache of the physical drives attached to the controller are enabled
enumDescriptions.Enabled: The write cache of the physical drives attached to the controller are enabled

ElevatorSort.description: Enables the controller to sort requests to a physical drive

enumDescriptions.Disabled: The controller will perform the requests as they are recieved in order to improve request throughput
enumDescriptions.Enabled: The controller will sort the requests to minimize the amount of seeking the drive must perform in order to reduce seek times

EncryptionBootPasswordSet.description: True if there is a boot password set, false otherwise

EncryptionCryptoOfficerPasswordSet.description: True if a password has been set for the Encryption Crypto Officer, false otherwise

EncryptionCspTestPassed.description: True if the encryption CSP test passed, false otherwise.

EncryptionEnabled.description: True if encryption is currently enabled for this controller, false otherwise

EncryptionFwLocked.description: True if the controller firmware has been locked, preventing firmware updates, false otherwise

EncryptionHasLockedVolumes.description: True if the controller has one or more volumes that are locked, false otherwise

EncryptionHasLockedVolumesMissingBootPas.description: True if there are locked drives due to a missing boot password, false otherwise

EncryptionHasSuspendedVolumes.description: True if the controller password has been temporarily suspended, false otherwise

EncryptionKeySet.description: True if the Master Key has been set, false otherwise

EncryptionLocalKeyCacheEnabled.description: True if the controller caches encryption keys locally when a remote key manager is being used, false otherwise

EncryptionMixedVolumesEnabled.description: True if the controller will allow plaintext and encrypted volumes to exist simultaneously, false otherwise

EncryptionPhysicalDriveCount.description: The number of encrypted physical drives attached to the controller

EncryptionRecoveryParamsSet.description: True if the encryption password recovery question and answer have been set, false otherwise

EncryptionStandaloneModeEnabled.description: True if the controller manages encryption keys locally, false if a remote key manager is being used

EncryptionSelfTestPassed.description: True if the encryption self test passed, false otherwise.

EncryptionUserPasswordSet.description: True if a password has been set for the Encryption User, false otherwise.

ExpandPriority.description: The level of priority that transformations have over handling current operating system requests

enumDescriptions.High: Transformations will complete as fast as possible at the expense of normal I/O
enumDescriptions.Low: Transformations will perform only when normal I/O is not occurring and may take longer to complete
enumDescriptions.Medium: Transformations will perform with some impact on normal I/O

FlexibleLatencySchedulerSetting.description: This allows the controller to process certain high-latency requests after a delay that may time out when elevator sorting

enumDescriptions.Aggressive10: The controller will apply a cutoff value of 10ms when suspending elevator sorting
enumDescriptions.Aggressive30: The controller will apply a cutoff value of 30ms when suspending elevator sorting
enumDescriptions.Default: The controller will rely only on elevator sorting
enumDescriptions.Low250: The controller will apply a cutoff value of 250ms when suspending elevator sorting
enumDescriptions.Middle100: The controller will apply a cutoff value of 100ms when suspending elevator sorting
enumDescriptions.Middle50: The controller will apply a cutoff value of 50ms when suspending elevator sorting

HardwareRevision.description: The hardware revision of the controller

InconsistencyRepairPolicy.description: Enables the controller to update data on RAID 6(ADG) and 60 volumes based on parity information when an inconsistency is discovered during surface scan

enumDescriptions.Disabled: The controller will only update the parity information and leave the data untouched
enumDescriptions.Enabled: The controller will update the data on the drives based on the parity information

IsBootController.description: True if this controller is the OS boot controller, false otherwise

Links.description: The URIs to the resource related to HpSmartStorageSmartArray

LogicalDrives.description: link to collection of membertype HpSmartStorageLogicalDrive

PhysicalDrives.description: link to collection of membertype HpSmartStorageDiskDrive. This constitutes inventory of all physical drives in the system

StorageEnclosures.description: link to collection of membertype HpSmartStorageStorageEnclosure

UnconfiguredDrives.description: link to collection of membertype HpSmartStorageDiskDrive. This constitutes inventory of all unconfigured physical drives (i.e. drives that haven't been configured as data or spare drives for a logical drive)

enumDescriptions.PCISlot: The PCI slot the controller is located at. For embedded controllers, the slot is 0

LogicalDriveCount.description: The number of logical drives configured on this controller

MaxParallelSurfaceScanCount.description: Maximum number of disks that the controller supports scanning in parallel

Model.description: The model number for the controller

WriteCacheWithoutBackupPowerEnabled.description: True if the controller will continue to use write cache even if the backup power source is not available. False, otherwise.

OperatingModeAfterReboot.description: The operating mode the controller will be functioning in (RAID versus HBA) after a reboot

enumDescriptions.HBA: The controller will be functioning in HBA mode after rebooting
enumDescriptions.RAID: The controller will be functioning in RAID mode after rebooting
enumDescriptions.Mixed: The controller will be functioning in Mixed mode after rebooting

ParallelSurfaceScanSupported.description: True if the controller supports scanning multiple disk surfaces

PhysicalDriveCount.description: The number of physical drives attached to this controller

PowerModeAfterReboot.description: The power mode of the controller after a reboot

enumDescriptions.Invalid: The controller will be operating in an unknown power mode after a reboot
enumDescriptions.Low: The controller will be operating in minimum power mode after a reboot
enumDescriptions.LowAutomated: The controller will be operating in a balanced mode after a reboot
enumDescriptions.Performant: The controller will be operating in maximum performance power mode after a reboot

PowerModeConfigured.description: The current power mode of the controller

enumDescriptions.Invalid: The power mode can not be determined
enumDescriptions.Low: The controller is currently operating in minimum power mode
enumDescriptions.LowAutomated: The controller is currently operating in a balanced power mode
enumDescriptions.Performant: The controller is currently operating in maximum performance power mode

PowerModeWarningChangedDrive.description: True if the controller's drive configuration has changed while using configuration based power settings, false otherwise

PowerModeWarningChangedMode.description: True if the controller has a new power mode configured, false otherwise

PowerModeWarningReboot.description: True if a reboot is required to change the active power mode on the controller, false otherwise

enumDescriptions.RequiredNoReason: A reboot is required for the configured power mode on the controller
enumDescriptions.RequiredPerformance: Rebooting will enhance the performance of the controller
enumDescriptions.RequiredPowerSavings: Rebooting will enable additional power savings on the controller

PowerModeWarningTemperature.description: True if the controller has crossed a critical temperature threshold and performance has been reduced to prevent damage to the controller, false otherwise

PredictiveSpareRebuild.description: Enables or disables predictive spare rebuild mode

enumDescriptions.Disabled: Spare drives will replace physical drives only when they fail
enumDescriptions.Enabled: Spare drives will replace physical drives that are predicted to fail preemptively

QueueDepth.description: This sets the maximum number of requests the controller will submit to a drive at any given time

enumDescriptions.Automatic: Automatically determine the best queue depth for the controller

ReadCachePercent.description: This indicates the percentage of cache used for read cache on the controller, with the rest of the cache being used for write cache

RebuildPriority.description: The level of priority that rebuilds have over handling current operating system requests

enumDescriptions.High: Rebuilds will complete as fast as possible at the expense of normal I/O
enumDescriptions.Low: Rebuilds will perform only when normal I/O is not occurring and may take longer to complete
enumDescriptions.Medium: Rebuilds will perform with some impact on normal I/O
enumDescriptions.RapidHigh: Rebuilds will complete as fast as possible at the expense of normal I/O
enumDescriptions.RapidLow: Rebuilds will perform only when normal I/O is not occurring and may take longer to complete
enumDescriptions.RapidMedium: Rebuilds will perform with some impact on normal I/O
enumDescriptions.RapidMediumHigh: Rebuilds will perform with an impact on normal I/O

SerialNumber.description: The serial number for this controller

SoftwareRaidHbaFirmwareRev.description: The firmware version of the underlying HBA that is being used by the software RAID stack

SoftwareRaidHbaModeOptionRomRev.description: The option ROM firmware version used to bootstrap the software RAID stack

SparePhysicalDriveCount.description: he number of physical drives assigned as spare drives attached to this controller

SupportedOperatingModes.description: A list of operating modes supported on this controller

enumDescriptions.HBA: The controller supports functioning in HBA mode
enumDescriptions.RAID: The controller supports functioning in RAID mode
enumDescriptions.Mixed: The controller supports functioning in Mixed mode

SupportedPowerModes.description: A list of the power modes that are supported on this controller

enumDescriptions.Low: The controller is currently operating in minimum power mode
enumDescriptions.LowAutomated: The controller is currently operating in a balanced power mode
enumDescriptions.Performant: The controller is currently operating in maximum performance power mode

SupportedRaidLevels.description: A list of RAID levels supported on this controller

enumDescriptions.0: There is no fault tolerance used on the logical drive
enumDescriptions.1: Two sets of duplicate data is being stored on a pair of drives
enumDescriptions.10: Data is duplicated and striped across pairs of disk drives
enumDescriptions.10ADM: Data is duplicated and striped across trios of disk drives
enumDescriptions.1ADM: Three sets of duplicate data is being stored on a trio of drives
enumDescriptions.5: Fault tolerance is achieved by storing parity data across 3 or more disk drives
enumDescriptions.50: Fault tolerance is achieved by storing parity data and striping the data across 6 or more disk drives
enumDescriptions.6: Fault tolerance is achieved by storing multiple sets parity data across 4 or more disk drives
enumDescriptions.60: Fault tolerance is achieved by storing multiple sets parity data and striping the data across 8 or more disk drives

SurfaceScanAnalysisPriority.description: Priority that the controller takes to find and correct disk surface errors

enumDescriptions.Disabled: Surface scan is disabled and may lead to data loss
enumDescriptions.High: Surface scan commands will be sent with the host I/O, resulting in faster scanning, but may inpact host I/O performance
enumDescriptions.Idle: Surface scan commands will ony be issued when no host I/O is present after a delay
enumDescriptions.Low: Surface scan commands have a low priority, and will have little impact on host I/O performance
enumDescriptions.Medium: Surface scan commands have a medium priority, and will have some impact on host I/O performance

UnassignedPhysicalDriveCount.description: The number of unassigned physical drives attached to this controller

WriteCacheBypassThresholdKB.description: This value sets the write cache bypass threshold, ranging from 16 KB to 1040 KB in multiples of 16 KB, where all writes larger than the specified value in KB units will bypass the write cache and be written directly to the disk for non-parity RAID volumes.

title: #HpeSmartStorageArrayController.v2_2_0.HpeSmartStorageArrayController
